name: cashprizes
text: i love that beef's depression is generally overlooked. it's every depressive's dream come true.

name: dezufnocosem
text: your fried chimichangas tell a different tale

name: goro
text: Absolutely. This strip encapsulates the desire for isolation so perfectly, it's really a dream come true. A horrible dream.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I have always been fascinated by Space.

name: gumfish
text: I don't think there's a single person on earth who wouldn't go into space given the chance.

name: stwee
text: getting left there though? not so much

name: tekende
text: I would not go. I hate just flying on an airplane. I can't even imagine how much worse going into space would be.

name: landowmpg
text: I agree, but I would like to just be in space.  I couldn't do the going up part though.

name: tangles
text: which says something about the earth

name: jamers
text: Resonates on such a deep level. Awesome arc.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: This arc always makes me think about that Sesame Street song where Ernie flies to the moon.

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "Roast Beef is coming home."

name: erinye
text: That had better be a reference to that one song. Peter Schilling or whoever, right?

name: snowman
text: I think it was Reading-too-much-into-it Schilling.

name: erinye
text:
People on the internet overanalyzing a comic?

I'm genuinely shocked. Surely there is no precedent for this.

name: mremaknu
text: Major Tom. Yay.

name: luckyg
text: How did Roast Beef beat Pat to the spacesuit and get back to the rocket without Pat noticing?

name: honesttom
text: Maybe Pat was distracted by some opportunity to be an asshole to someone.

name: morypcaina
text: [self-important reference to Pat's later revelation of gayness, followed by innuendo about gay sex]

name: aaron_haynes
text: in- YOUR -end-o.

name: bartleby
text: I like to think Roast Beef has a space suit stashed somewhere close by in case he ever gets the chance to go die in outer space.

name: yingkaixing
text: This is the comment I was scrolling down to make.

name: boyd
text: Sheer determination to die, I suppose.

name: lawbot
text: This is the best arc. Straight up.

name: steerpike66
text: It is kind of kick-ass depression that leads one to steal a rocket and escape into space.

name: trollcollins
text: I have read this strip maybe 10 times, but this is the first time where it occurred to me: Pat built a fucking rocket ship . That is just crazy. Pat isn't 1/6 as smart as he thinks he is. I guess it is because this is still sort of proto Achewood and characters haven't settled on their final forms yet. Still: wow.

name: boredom_man
text: Oh, I dunno. I've met some pretty brilliant engineers who thought they could also be social engineers and were so, so wrong.

name: trollcollins
text: My brother and one of my best friends are both engineers, and they are pretty socially savvy, but holy crap you are right, there are some technically brilliant yet socially retarded engineers. Well, not just engineers, but I think many of them do find a home in technical schools and engineering faculties.

name: bixschmix
text: It is a scary day when a drunken friend becomes a genuine rocket scientist.

name: tripleg
text: just ask Jim Lovell?

name: landowmpg
text:
This is a pretty small rocket ship though, only big enough to hold a single cat, so it would require much less technical competency. Though probably still beyond Pat's means.

Side note: I love how the rocket looks like one of those retro sci-fi rockets like Marvin the Martian used to fly around in.

name: theplaidknight
text: This one evokes a tear of sadness, and one of laughing really damned hard

name: aelindil
text: I am now proceeding to read this arc while listening to Psapp's "Cozy in the Rocket."  It will be RAAAAD!

name: razorman57
text: this is the saddest comic ever.

name: weretrout
text: This should instead be titled 'The Rocket Strip'

name: raytoupee
text:
EARTH BELOW US

DRIFTING, FALLING

name: undyingsong
text: Floating, weightless...
